Metadata: Ballast Exchange (Volume 6, Spring/Summer 2006): Newsletter of the West Coast Ballast Outreach Project
University of California Sea Grant Extension Program
Previous issues published and funded by the West Coast Ballast Outreach Project (WCBOP).
Previous issues of this newsletter were under the Type Code: CUIMR; Changed to CASG

In this issue: California's Marine Invasive Species Program, by M. B. Falkner; Vessel Fouling: New attention to an old NIS vector, by L. Takata; Ships' Sea Chests: An overlooked mechanism for species transfers, by A. Coutts; Styela clava Invades New Zealand, A. Coutts; The Clubbed Sea Squirt Styela clava in North America, by N. Dobroski; MatsonTests Ballast Water Treatment System Designed by Ecochlor on the ITB Maku Pahu, by N.Dobroski; Examining the potential for invaders to hitchhike on ships at the Aquatic Bioinvasion Research and Policy Institute (ABRPI), by I. Davidson; Invasive Seaweed threatens California's coastline in - An Update, by R. Woodfield. Keywords: Marine Invasive Species Program, vessel fouling, Styela clava, bioinvasion, invasive seaweed.
